112.content:
Lina, Gourry, and Naga were minding their own business, travelling along while looking for their next adventure. But their fate became drastically altered. A bolt of blue lightning struck each of them, and they were gone.

======================
A mysterious place...
======================

The three of them reappeared, each one chained to a stone slab. Their stomachs were bared, arcane writing on each one.

Lina was the first to come to.

"Unnngh... What hit me?" Lina said. She looked around, and saw nothing save her friend Gourry and her rival Naga strapped down to tables, darkness all around them in every direction. She scowled.

"Hey! Wake up!" she snapped. Gourry and Naga both winced at the familiar sound of Lina's voice, and slowly came too.

"L-Lina?" Gourry said, "Where are we?"

Lina sighed, and shook her head. "I was hoping you knew. And what's SHE doing here?" she said, gesturing with her head to Naga.

Naga scowled. "I could ask you the same question, little girl. I was collecting treasure from a band of vandals when a bolt of lightning struck me. Since you're here too, I assume it wasn't from you," she said. She smirked, then added, "Although maaybe it was you, and you're a more inept sorceress than I already thought you were."

Lina snarled viciously. "I DIDN'T CAST WHATEVER IT WAS THAT BROUGHT US HERE!"

Gourry shook his head. "Ladies, please, calm down. There has to be an explination for this."

"THERE IS," thundered a voice. "I HAVE BROUGHT YOU ALL HERE FOR REVENGE."

The three of them traded nervous looks. "Who are you, sir?" Gourry said, looking around for the source of the voice.

"I AM THE SERPENT GOD WHOSE SERVANTS YOU DESTROYED," the voice thundered.

-Servants of a serpent god?- Lina thought, confused, -Doesn't ring any bells...-

Naga, however, remembered. "So you're the god those looneys were worshipping. The Cult of F'an F'aran."

Lina and Gourry traded shocked looks, remembering.

"INDEED. I AM F'AN F'ARAN," the voice said, a pair of red, glowing eyes appearing above the group. The three stared at him defiantly.

"We've faced down Ruby-Eye Shabranigdu and lived to exaggerate how easily we destroyed him. What makes you think you'll fare any better than he did?"

F'an chuckled. "BECAUSE UNLIKE THAT FOOL RUBY-EYE, I'M NOT GOING TO FIGHT YOU. I HAVE SOMETHING MUCH WORSE IN MIND FOR YOU THREE."

Lina, Naga, and Gourry all traded nervous looks. Finally, Naga laughed her trademark laugh, noting with satisfaction the eyes wincing.

"You think you scare us? We've overcome everything thrown at us, and we'll overcome this!"

A mouth appeared, a toothy, grinning mouth that made the three adventurers quiver with fear. "I RATHER DOUBT THAT. BECAUSE WHAT I'M GOING TO DO IS SIMPLY ENHANCE SOMETHING YOU THREE ALREADY HAVE TO UNIMAGINABLE PORTIONS, AND GRANT YOU AN ABILITY OF MINE. THAT ABILITY IS THE ABILITY TO SWALLOW ANYTHING WHOLE AND DIGEST IT, AND WHAT I'M GOING TO ENHANCE IS YOUR HUNGER!!!"

Blue lightning struck the three chained down adventurers. They screamed as the lightning flowed through their bodies, the curse taking effect as they were sent back. F'an laughed viciously.

"WE'LL SEE HOW WELL REGARDED THOSE THREE ARE ONCE THEY START CONSUMING EVERYTHING AND EVERYONE IN SIGHT!!!"

"Let go, Felicia," Rikuo said, not turning around.

Felicia shook her head. "Rikuo, come on! It won't be that bad!"

"A cat eating me won't be that bad? Forget it. Now let GO!" Rikuo said, extending his claws and slashing at her. Felicia barely managed to dodge, his claws catching her robe and ripping it off. She stepped back, extending her own claws.

"I didn't want it to come to this, Rikuo. I really didn't," she said, "But trust me when I say that this will be better for all of us in the end."

Rikuo snarled. His eyes began to glow as he tapped into the dark force energies that all Darkstalkers commanded, the waters behind him starting to churn and swell. "You're delusional, cat. Jedah altering your body has made you just as insane as he is. I'm not gonna let you eat me, Felicia. And with any luck, I'll be able to beat some sense into you. SEA RAGE!!"

Rikuo thrust his hands forward, and the waters behind him surged forward in a massive wave. Felicia, agile as ever despite her new bulk, leaped up to a nearby tree and backflipped off of it, diving down towards Rikuo in a kick. She meant it when she said she didn't want it to come down to a fight, but she was intent on eating Rikuo and wasn't about to let anything stop her!

((Edited on 8/8/2005 by FFtheSnake))
114112111222121111121.title: Rikuo-O!!!

1142.content:
Felicia smacked herself in the face. "NO! No, that's wrong. That's JEDAH talking."

She slapped herself a few more times until the urge passed. She sighed, and kissed the chubby young Nonno on the cheek. When she didn't start salivating again, she relaxed.

"Now that those urges have passed, I'll go get some breakfast."

Giggling, she picked a pen and paper out of a nearby trashcan and wrote her fellow catgirls a note.

"Gone hunting. Be back soon. If not, my belly is just too big to move and I'll be back later. Hope you slept well!"

Felicia left it on her chair and sighed. She popped her neck and changed to her housecat form, trotting calmly out of the alley.

A few minutes later, on the rooftop nearby, a muscular, grey-furred form appeared. He looked down and spied Felicia's note, his excellent eyes allowing him to read it from his vantage point.

"Hm? So much for getting a morning quicky," he grumbled. He leaped off the rooftop and leaped from wall to wall, quickly descending to the ground. He was a werewolf, and a handsome specimen at that. A muscular creature with thick greyish fur and a long muzzle, clad in blue sweatpants and a yellow belt-sash. His name was Jon Talbain, and he was a longtime friend of Felicia's. He, like others who were called Darkstalkers, been through the same process Felicia had been through. But once Jedah was defeated, he and Felicia had maintained a bit of a friendship, occasionally meeting up for sex or hunting for prey.

The difference being that Jon was more willing to eat other monsters than Felicia, who preferred humans. He had kept this secret from Felicia, but since Jedah captured all the Darkstalkers and put them through the alterations a few years ago, he had consumed five catgirls, six vampires, nine succubi, three merpeople, and his fellow Darkstalker, Lord Raptor. He would have tried for more, but his metabolism was slower than Felicia's and he tended to pile on weight quickly. But when the meals were good, he didn't care. Especially if he got sex first. Today, he was in the mood for humans, and wanted to invite Felicia on a hunt and a date. But now it seemed that she had other plans.

He sighed, about to change to his human form and head for his home in the city, when his stomach rumbled.

He put a paw to his belly and frowned. "Now I'm REALLY hungry."

He sighed again, and was about to leave, when he grinned, getting an idea. He turned slowly, licking his chops as he admired the sleeping catgirls.

"It's not like they'll be gone," he said, "Since they aren't human, I'll absorb their souls into mine after they're digested. If I'm lucky, I can get some action out of the older kitties before I eat them."

He chuckled. "And if I don't that's fine. Felicia's probably considered eating them herself. And if not, I can just eat her."

He rubbed his hands together eagerly. "And now that I've finished making justifications to cover the fact that I'm a horny, gluttonous little bastard and proud of it, it's breakfast time!"

==================
Majigen...
Jedah's Chamber...
==================

"Perfect..." Jedah said, watching on an enchanted viewscreen, "I'm still not sure what my changes did to them to make them this gluttonous, but it plays into my plans perfectly. Going the subtle route was the right idea, especially since that foolish hunter Dante nearly killed me. If this works, I'll consume whomever consumes the others. If it doesn't, I'll probably be consumed myself."

Jedah laughed his shrill laugh. "Then again, that might not be so bad. Because either way, my plan gets accomplished."

11422.content:
=====================
Las Vegas alleyways....
Downtown...
====================

Felicia huffed, irritated. It had been an hour since she started searching for food, and hadn't found anything or anyone worth eating. She had even considered looking into dumpsters and trash cans for something, but she hadn't done that in years and the concept of doing it now just made her ill.

Eventually, though, her efforts were rewarded, as she spotted something interesting across the street.

"Manny & Jack's Pet Boutique. Mmm!" Felicia said, licking her lips, her flat, sexy stomach grumbling in anticipation. She patted it and shifted into her housecat form. She looked around to make sure no one was coming, and scampered across the street, heading around to the back of the building. She shifted to her humanoid form again and tested the door, finding it locked.

"No problem," she said, using her claws to slash the door open. She wasn't concerned about time, because the store's hours said that they were closed for the weekend and the metal shutters were down over the door and windows of the front, hiding her completely from the outside world. She did think, as she went inside, to brace the back door shut with a trash can. But once she was done, she was focused completely on the buffet before her.

"Ooooh, oh so yummy. Little furry wigglys, all gonna go down into my tummy," she said, looking around in the pitch dark room at the sleeping animals, cats and dogs, birds, rabbits, gerbils, hamsters, guinea pigs, mice, and fish. The animals all looked up when they caught Felicia's scent, the sexy, wide-hipped catwoman sauntering in and looking over what she considered to be the menu. The rodents all cowered in fear, the cats gave her an interested look before relaxing again, and the dogs all started barking. Felicia ignored them, wandering about the store, her tail idly caressing the cages and pen, taking inventory of the store's stock.

She rubbed her paws together, chuckling wickedly. "Hmm, let's see, twenty gerbils, five rabbits, ten hamsters, ten guinea pigs, thirty mice, seven birds, nine cats, four dogs, and lots of fish. Where to start, where to start," she said, "Everything looks so gooood..."

She paused at the gerbil pen, the furry little creatures scampering about in fear from the large, busty catwoman looming over them and licking her lips. Grinning, she reached one of her large, unweildy paws into the pen and gently picked up one by the scruff of its neck. She purred, slowly raising the struggling, terrified creature up to her mouth and grinned viciously.

"Aww, poor little thing," she said, letting her hot, moist breath wash over the gerbil, "Are you scared?" She purred, and let the gerbil drop into her other paw, where it just stared at her fearfully, shivering. She grinned toothily, and said "Don't worry little one. You'll be a nice, safe, warm place soon."

She giggled wickedly and gripped it again with her claws, lifting the wriggling little creature up over her mouth. She licked her lips, savoring the creature's fright, and said, "VERY warm indeed." She opened her mouth wide, and dropped the gerbil inside. Her jaws snapped shut, and the gerbil became trapped inside Felicia's maw. She purred delightedly, letting the creature struggle about, its fear so rich that she could taste it on her rough tongue, which slurped all over the helpless little creature as it squeaked in panic, trying to escape. Her cheeks bulged out as it pressed around, trying to look for an opening. Finally, Felicia felt it feel up to her lips. She chuckled, and let it poke it's head out of her lips, looking directly down into the gerbil pen as she did. She let the gerbil in her mouth look around for a moment, before slurping it back into her mouth and swallowing, a tiny bulge going down her gullet and disappearing into her body.

She licked her lips, letting out an exaggerated 'mmmm' of delight as she rubbed her stomach in a slow, sensual manner. She leaned over the cage again and picked up another gerbil, not bothering with the taunting this time and simply placing the creature in her mouth. She swallowed, another bulge going down her throat and disappearing into her sexy body.

She continued to eat the gerbils, gulping them down one after another, her tummy starting to gain a slight bulge to it as she simply slid the small creatures down her gullet. Finally, the gerbil pen was empty, leaving only a catgirl with a bulging stomach nearby. She licked her lips and patted her tummy, purring happily from the feeling of all the wriggling inside of her. She grinned at the other animals, who cowered in fear at the aura Felicia's prescence held.

"What you have just witnessed is gluttony in action. Every living thing in this shop is going inside my belly for keeps. Those little 'sliders' were just the first, as I am still RAVENOUS, and since I'm the top of the food chain in this room, that means some of you are next. I just have to decide which of you to snack on now."
11422.title: Felicia's Breakfast

6 years before the events of The Lion King...

"Eat it. C'mon, I DARE you," said the young, teenaged lion with the dark gold fur said, his handsome face marred by a slash scar over one eye.

The older, lighter-furred, brown-maned lion frowned. "I don't know about this, Taka..."

"I want to be called Scar now, I said. And COME ON, Mufasa. Live a little. I'm not trying to poison you, I just want you to try this. It's something the hyena tribe leader, Shenzi, showed me."

Mufasa sighed at his younger brother. "I don't know. I mean, swallowing a warthog whole?"

Scar nodded, and gestured to the fat, unconcious warthog in front of them.

"C'mon. You can do it, I know you can. I've seen the huge hunks you eat out of your kills, you pig," Scar taunted.

"This is different," Mufasa insisted, "I don't know if I can stretch wide enough to fit this lardass in me."

Scar frowned, then grinned, trying a different tactic. "Shenzi could do it. You want me to go around telling people that you got outclassed by a HYENA in something?"

Mufasa glared at Scar. "Cheap shot, brother."

Scar grinned, knowing that he'd try to do it now.

Mufasa sighed, and shook his head. "Okay, okay, let's see if I can do this," he said, lowering his head toward's the pig's hindquarters and opening his jaws wide...

1221121.content:
==============
Pride Rock...
==============

Scar sighed wearily, the old lion glaring at his nephew as he scampered about, playfully chasing a butterfly that had gotten the nerve to fly up to Pride Rock.

He scowled inwardly. Damn those hyenas, he thought, I can't trust them to do a single thing right.

Scar wanted to rule the kingdom after his brother's death. But with the birth of Simba, the birthright now passed to the youthful cub.

Leaving Scar forever a prince, seconded forever by his brother and his cub.

He scowled inwardly, turning his attention away from the cub to a small rodent scurrying through the cave. Deciding against his usual taunting speeches to his meals, he decided to just simply eat the damn thing.

He caught the rodent expertly between his paws and flung it upwards, catching it in his mouth with expert ease and swallowing it, savoring the whimpering struggles of the tiny creature as it fell down into his belly.

He chuckled softly. Oh, if only I could dispose of Simba that easily...

But even as the thought occured to him, an idea started to form. ...Maybe I COULD dispose of him that easily!

He looked around, spotting no one, and stared at Simba, still innocently playing with that butterfly.

Certainly, he's small enough, Scar thought, getting hungrier every second he held onto this idea, And it'd be easily to claim that he ran off while I was sleeping off a meal. Mufasa is a gullible fool... But do I dare?

Scar knew full well what Mufasa's wrath was like. A cheetah that had tried to eat Simba a couple weeks ago was shredded by Mufasa in retaliation, the remains served to his lionesses as a gift for their efforts in feeding the pride. It was sheer luck and cowardice-enduced spped the hyenas escaped with their lives.

But still, the chance to be rid of Simba was too great to pass up...

12212221.content:
=============
Pridelands...
=============

It had been years since Simba's death. Nala had matured greatly since that day. But when the lands are run by a vicious maniac and the hyenas, one has to grow up quickly or die in their bellies. More than once she saw a hyena with a belly swollen with a lion cub that had been swallowed alive. And since Scar was the only male lion around for miles, that meant he didn't care that the hyenas were eating his offspring.

Only one of the lionesses seemed to trust Scar to know best, an elder lioness named Zira.

Nala hated her. She was impossibly deluded. She was helping Scar let the Pridelands die. She hadn't even blinked when Scar let Shenzi, the hyena's leader, swallow all her cubs whole and alive, save for a young male named Nuka.

Nala couldn't stand it anymore. She had to get out of there. When Scar sent out a hunting group to look for food that wasn't there anymore, she ran off, leaving them behind. None of the other lionesses were strong enough to fight Scar, especially with Zira backing him up.

She had to find help.

However, first she had to find food. It had been several days since she had last eaten something decent...

122122221.content:
=====================
The pridelands...
One day in summer...
=====================

It had been a year since the death of Zira and unifying of the Outlanders and Simba's pride. She and Kovu were very happy together, and were well respected amongst the pridelands, although the respect from animals they usually ate was tense at best.

Kiara was out hunting one day. Kovu had been very good to her, and had recently saved her from an attack by the hyenas, and she wanted to get him his favorite prey as a special treat.

She sighed as she thought about the hyenas. Her father had told her that the hyenas were once noble hunters, a matriarchy of warriors whom they shared the pridelands with. But they had degenerated into scavengers and poachers shortly after Kiara's grandfather, Mufasa, had come to power. Kovu had suggested that Scar may have been responsible.

Kiara shook her head. She wished she could have helped them, help restore them to the way they once were, so they wouldn't have to wage war with them. But as she grew up, she had become a bit of a realist, and knew that all the world's problems couldn't be solved. So she concentrated on those she could solve.

Like finding the source of that interesting noise she was hearing.

Slowly, carefully, she stalked through the tall grass, the clumsiness of her youth gone, thanks both to Simba's training and the warrior-like refinement she had gained from Kovu. She peered through the edge of the grass to get a look at what she was following... and gasped...

1221222221.content:
============
Hell...
============

A tawny furred lioness ran through fields of flame, desperately trying to get away from the demonic creature chasing her.

"ZZIIIIIIIIIIRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAA..." the creature moaned, "COOOOOOMEE BAAAAAAAAACK TOOOOOOOO MEEEEEEEE..."

Tears flowing down her muzzle, she ran. Ever since she had commited suicide rather than accept Kiara's help and gain possible redemption, she had been trapped in this horrid place, running from this demon and never getting away, never having time to rest.

But she had to run.

If she didn't, Scar would catch her.

On and on she ran, until a pool of darkness opened up beneath her. Before she could stop, she fell directly into it.

She fell for seemingly forever, and landed roughly on the ground in a black void. Groaning, she got to her feet and looked around, seeing nothing in every direction. So dark was it, that she couldn't see herself.

Then, after a short moment, light did come, in the form of two glowing, yellow-green eyes.

Zira stared at them, smelled smoke and brimstone, and cowered.

"Who... Who are you? What do you want?"

"My name I shall tell you later," said the voice belonging to those frightening eyes, "What I want is to give you a second chance."

Zira blinked, confused. "A... second chance?" she said, doubtful.

The voice chuckled. "Yes... A second chance at revenge. A chance to let your hatred quite literally consume your enemies."

Zira shook her head. "This is just a trick... A trick of hell..."

The voice laughed. "Hell holds no power over me. I am become darkness itself, and now I fear neither God nor Satan."

Zira frowned. "What... What do I have to do?"

"Simply say yes. And I will send you back to Earth and give you the power to quite literally let your hatred devour your enemies completely."

Suddenly, Zira realized what the voice meant.

"You wish me to consume them?" Zira asked.

"Whole and alive," the voice said, the eyes narrowing with amusement, "A bit of serpent magic I picked up in the pit. Say yes and I shall make you a demon of gluttony. Your whole world shall be yours for the eating."

The offer was too good. And ANYTHING was better than being chased forever by a nightmarishly distorted version of Scar.

"Yes..." Zira said.

The voice laughed as flames flared up around the darkness, revealing for the first time that the eyes were connected to a massive, hulking black dragon with a dark purple underbelly and massive wings.

"So be it, then! Let darkness fill you completely! Consume your world and all things within it!" the dragon said, flapping her wings, "Gain vengeance on your foes, and serve my purpose! So sayeth MALEFICENT!"

Tentacles of darkness shot up around Zira and pulled her further into the ground, which had suddenly become soft and murky. Before she could scream, she was engulphed by it.

================================
A different pridelands...
50 miles away from Pride Rock...
================================

The lioness and her mate cooed over their cubs, the four playful little creatures gamboling and wrestling around the savannah. The lion nuzzled her mate and said, "Let me go get food for them."

The lioness shook her head, and started to get up. "No, my love, it's my job to..."

The lion nudged her back down. "You've just given birth yesterday. Exiles like us have to take care of each other, y'know, so let me take care of you."

The lioness tried to protest again, but the lion insisted and eventually convinced her to stay. He trotted off, and the lioness turned back to her cubs after watching her leave.

But when she did, she gasped.

One of her cubs was now sporting a tremendous belly, sucking down a tiny tail. The forms of the other three cubs could be seen in her stomach as she took one final swallow, the tailtip disappearing into her mouth.

The cub let out a loud belch and licked her chops happily, grinning viciously at the frightened mother.

In an adult, mocking voice, the cub said, "I'm still hungry, mommy."

The last thing the lioness saw was her cub lunging for her, mouth opened wide...

=================================================
A little ways away from where the lioness was...
=================================================

The lion was on his way to hunt, when he heard his mate's frightened roar. He turned back, running to the cave and field where his family was.

When he got there, he could only stare in horror.

One of his cubs was swallowing his mate, the lioness's rump, madly thrashing tail and flailing legs hanging out of the cub's grossly stretched mouth, the wriggling inside of her belly showing that she had already devoured her siblings. The lion watched in stunned horror as his mate's hind end slowly vanished into the cub's maw.

With slow, deliberate swallows, the lioness slid into the cub's gullet, her throat visibly moving with each swallow. Soon, all that was left of the lioness was her tail, and that disappeared in a single, slurping gulp.

The cub let out a tremendous belch, laying on her side as her vastly belly wriggled, the forms inside writhing in agony. She licked her lips and turned, spotting the still horrified into paralysis lion.

"Oh look. Dessert."

=========================
Twenty minutes later...
=========================

The cub that Zira now was belched, her tremendously overful belly groaning and gurgling as it digested the lion, lioness, and other three cubs.

"Who knew that lions could be so delicious?" Zira said, laughing and belching again.

You have done well, Maleficent's voice said inside of Zira's head.

"Thank you," Zira said, groaning and belching again, loving the feeling of how full she was, "But I do have a question: It was ingenius of you to place me in that lioness's womb, but what now?"

You are a demon now. You digest souls as well as bodies. Once your meals fully become a part of you, you will be able to assume their form and use that against Simba and his family.

Zira grinned. "Marvelous. But while I'm not complaining about the chance for revenge or the fact that I'm now your servant, why are you doing this?"

Maleficent snarled. Because they helped a young boy halt my plans far too many times. I want all of the boy's friends to suffer, and on this world I have chosen you to do it.

"This world..." Zira said, "Then I assume you have made similar offers to people of similar mindsets as mine on other worlds?"

Maleficent chuckled. Indeed. Perhaps you'll meet them someday. Now relax and enjoy your meal. You'll need all your strength to infiltrate Pride Rock...

Maleficent's intimidating prescence faded from Zira's mind. She chuckled and relaxed, eventually drifting off to sleep and dreaming sweet dreams...
1221222221.title: Zira's Revenge

=============================
Watchtower Space Station...
=============================

It was a quiet day in the Watchtower. The current shift of Justice Leaguers were up there, manning the various monitors to watch for trouble and working with the staff to help keep the world safe. But in one place, things were not all that quiet.

Shayera Hall, once known as Hawkgirl, clutched her stomach, curled up in a fetal position. Her stomach grumbled loudly. Shayera cursed herself for not watching the time, for not keeping track of the date in Thanagarian time.

Every twenty years, a strange, unnatural hunger overcame all Thanagarians. Their bodies become superelastic around the mouth, throat and stomach areas, completely indestructable, their stomach's digestive process becoming powerful, and they are overcome with a ravenous, insatiable hunger for whole living beings. They must consume ravenously and endlessly until the time of the hunger passes. And Shayera's time had come. It would not end for a month. Which was the time of Shayera's current shift, and the Watchtower was filled with delicious-looking heroes and heroines...

Who to visit first, though?

124111.content:
Evolution's a funny thing. Because of how powerful they are, Pokemon should rule the world. However, humans adapted a defense against that - the ability to swallow things much larger than themselves whole and alive, and digest them without incident. This helped humans tame the wild, eventually working out the happy medium of the trainer system. But this isn't to say that Pokemon are helpless. Even with this adaption, without Pokeballs and other Pokemon catching tools, humans would still be at a disadvantage due to the powers of Pokemon. And humans know to avoid Legendary nests like the plague, as they are too powerful to fight even with a well-trained team.

Right now, even with this, it's still about even. Pokemon Trainers head out into the world with their teams, catching and sometimes eating Pokemon they find. And sometimes other trainers as well.

It is into this world that sixteen year old Ash Ketchum, newly licensed and with a belligerent but loyal Pikachu as his starter, headed out into.

1242.content:
Going out into the world was dangerous.

But you had to do it. Things you needed were out there.

You look at your Pokeballs. Inside is a trained team of Pokemon that you caught and convinced to be your friend. Which is important, as most Pokemon, even the tiny ones, would normally just swallow you whole.

Honestly, Pokeballs, Pokemon training, and the fact that humanity numbered in the billions were the only reason humanity wasn’t extinct yet. Because all Pokemon, even the smallest ones were capable of devouring humans whole.

And every single breed found us delicious.

The most dangerous were the Legendaries. Powerful Pokemon who were immune to capture, even from the Master Balls. No one knew why Pokemon started devouring humanity, but this was the way of the world. You just had to deal with it.

Trainers, good trainers, were considered heroes, as they could drive off predatory Pokemon seeking a meal. They were also allowed to feed people to their Pokemon whenever they wanted. In addition, women were encouraged to have as many children as possible, to keep the population up. It was a common sight in the city to see women ages 14 and up with bulging bellies, a baby nursing from their bare breasts, or both. So much was breeding encouraged, that men could easily get sex whenever they wanted. Because sex was so commonplace, proven rapes were prosecuted fiercely.

Which also meant evil trainers could simply feed their victims to their Pokemon without incident.

Pokemon breeders, on the other hand, were considered to be badasses. They worked with Pokemon on a regular basis without getting eaten, and in many cases had sex with their Pokemon. It was rumored that breeders had hybrid children with their Pokemon.

It was a dangerous world.

But you had to go out into it.

125.content:
((Author's Note: This universe blends elements from the Sega games, the SatAm cartoon/Archie comic universe, as well as Sonic X.))

"This time for sure, I will have my revenge," muttered the aged, decaying sorcerer. His tallow-skinned, skeletal frame shuffled from shelf to shelf, picking up powders and elixers and throwing them into the bubbling cauldron in the center of the small, cramped room. The sorcerer held in one hand a spellbook, muttering to himself as he threw the spell together.

He knew he was running out of time. He had been away from all his sources of power for too long.

Which wasn't surprising, since his enemies had destroyed them all years ago.

"For too long, the plans of I, the great Ixis Naugus have been thrwarted. By Sonic and his friends, by the fools of the Knothole Kingdom that has reclaimed more than nine-tenths of this world, and by that imbecile Robotnik's, who's empire has been steadily chipped away at by furs less intelligent than he is. But that all changes today."

He threw the final ingredient in, and the cauldron roiled, turning a bright red.

Ixis coughed up some blood, and put the spellbook aside, reciting the incantation.

"Clever fox and cunning bat, make your bellies grow round and fat,
"Eat all you see, eat all you meet,
"For all that exists, is your tasty treat,
"Fulfill my will, as I go to final rest,
"Fulfill thy stomachs, and pass my test,
"Eat all Mobius, so sayeth I!
"Make the enemies of Naugus DIE!!!"

Lightning lanced out of the cauldron, vaporizing Naugus into ash. But as he died, a smile came over his face as the spell went out in two directions, fading into invisiblility and striking its intended targets.

And somewhere on Mobius, Miles 'Tails' Prower and Rouge the Bat suddenly became very hungry...

"So... So there's nothing we can do?" Sonic said.

The gathered world leaders all started yelling at once, demanding to know how this happened. Sally waited until they were all done yelling to continue.

"As far as I can tell, Eggman unleashed the plague secretly before he actually announced his intention to use it, using the Egg Fleet attacks as a distraction. By the time we got to the chamber that held the plague, it had already been emptied. We're all starting to feel the effects... You've all already seen what happened to Mammoth Mogul, Doctor Finitevus, and Ixis Naugus..."

"This can't happen... There has to be something we can do to prevent this! Some cure!" said one leader.

Commander Tower, of G.U.N., acting as the Human/Overlander represnetative, shook his head. "Our scientists have been studying it. It adapts far faster than we can cure it, even with Shadow's Chaos powers acting as a booster," he said.

"So there's no way to stop this?" asked Dylan Porcupine. "There's nothing we can do?"

"Not to stop it, no..." Sally said softly. "But there is a way we can live through this... in a sense."

"What do you mean?" Rosemary Prower asked.

Sally took a deep breath. "...Because Nicole is NOT organic life, she will live through this. She'll live... well, forever, basically. And thanks to the upgrades she's been going through, she can preserve a limitless amount of data inside of her, create an entire world inside her mind. She can even convert living things to data, turning the biomass into more nanomachines."

"Very interesting, sister, but what..." Elias paused as the implications sank in.

Sally nodded. "If Nicole is allowed to consume the entire world and everyone on it, we'll all live on inside of her, in a world she can create for us that literally has no limits. Preserved forever in her memory banks, still ourselves, just... in a different form."

Everyone was too stunned to say anything at first. "A rather... drastic measure," said Sir Charles. "Will she go along with it?"

Sally nodded. "She's reluctant. That's why she's not present at this meeting, she's still trying to convince herself that I'm right. But she agrees that it's best to preserve life, even if just as nanotechs."

"As much as I am loathe... EXTREMELY loathe," Lupe added, glaring at the Felidae queen, who glared back, "to admit, Hathor is right. How are you so certain that this will be an effective way of preserving ourselves against Eggman's virus?"

Sally stood up from the computer monitor. "I am prepared to offer myself as an example," she said.

Nicole appeared in an instant, manifesting a nanotech body and grabbing her arm. "Sally, you can't!" she said. "If this fails, you'll essentially be deleted! If I must test it, let it be on one of the criminals we have locked up, Bean or Bark!"

Sonic came up to her, nodding. "Sally, she's right! You can't risk yourself like this!"

Sally smiled and kissed Sonic. "I have to," she said. "This is the only way to show that it's safe." She turned to Nicole, the lynx's ears drooping nervously. "I'm ready," she said.

Nicole bit her lip, and nodded. "Well... If you're sure..." she said. Sally nodded, and Nicole took a deep breath to calm herself. She opened her jaws widely, and gently pushed Sally's muzzle inside. She closed it gently around the half-squirrel, gently tasting her with her tongue as she swallowed, her mouth expanding to fully take in Sally's head.

The world leaders and Freedom Fighters watched in fascination as Nicole slowly swallowed Sally Acorn whole, her jaws distending easily around the princess's slender, muscular body. The AI lynx couldn't resist, snaking her tongue out to taste Sally's fur as she swallowed her breasts. She was almost ashamed to admit to herself that she found Sally to be incredibly delicious.

Nicole stifled a belch as best she could. She didn't notice that Hathor, Lupe, and several others were trying to hide the fact that the sight they just witnessed was arousing to them despite how weak they felt.

Nicole just blushed, rubbing her belly.

Nicole bit her lip. "Are you sure?"

Sally nodded. "This is the only way we can survive, Nicole," she said confidently.

Nicole sighed. "Very well..." she said softly. "Engaging processing." She closed her eyes and concentrated on the biomass in her avatar's stomach.

Sally gasped softly as nanotechs swarmed over her, her clothes dissolving quickly. She gasped, nanotechs invading her throat. Dr. Eggman looked at the small vial of green liquid in his hand. “I’d almost forgotten that I had made this…” he said softly.

His two mechanical minions, Orbot and Cubot, looked at him worriedly. “For some reason, sir, you holding vials of unknown substances makes me nervous.”

“For good reason,” Dr. Eggman said. “This virus has the potential to upset the balance of power in this war. You see, it genetically alters certain Mobians, giving them great elasticity in their bodies, from the inside out.”

Orbot frowned. “Okay…”

“It also gives them a tremendous hunger for the flesh of other Mobians,” Dr. Eggman continued. “Imagine, seeing someone swallow another person whole just to satisfy their ravenous hunger…”

Cubot gulped nervously. “You… You said ‘certain Mobians…’”

Dr. Eggman smirked. “A surprisingly astute question from you,” he said. “Yes. I designed this virus TOO well. Not only is it 100% communicable and airborne, capable of spreading across the world in seconds, it works on a ‘meta’ level, for lack of a better term. Only individuals of a certain… well, ‘prominence in the universe’ for lack of a better term, will be affected. Joe Schmuck off the street wouldn’t be affected, but a Freedom Fighter would. So would my Egg Bosses…”

Orbot grimaced. “Oh dear…”

Dr. Eggman played with the sealed vial in his fingers. “Indeed. My studies indicate that even Nicole would be affected, the virus giving her enough of a physical body that she’s need to eat…”

“Sir, this sounds absurdly dangerous. If it is used, it would throw things into chaos. The madness that would result would be devastating, possibly as much to our cause as it would be to the Freedom Fighters, and oh damn it I just convinced you to use it, didn’t I?” Orbot said.

Dr. Eggman smirked at Orbot… and then ran for it.

“STOP HIIIM!” Orbot screamed, he and Cubot flying after their boss. They were far too slow, nor would any robot in the Death Egg fortress move against their creator as he got to one of the egg pods in the hanger. Orbot and Cubot got in an egg pod of their own and flew after him.

But it was too late.

Cackling like a lunatic, Dr. Eggman opened the vial and tossed it into the air. The green liquid inside spilled out, turning into a mist and flying off into the distance, spreading invisibly across the world in seconds.

Near them were Knuckles and the Chaotix, along with his longtime friends Amy and Tails. He remembered several different realities for them. A masked wolf he knew as Whisper, along with a hyperactive lemur named Tangle were standing with them. And there was also a badger named Sticks. Hers was a weird reality, because he remembered looking somewhat different in that world, and acting different as well.

He wasn't sure how to process this. He wasn't sure which reality he was remembering was real. And it was starting to frighten him.

Taking a look around, he noticed that there were others there too. Civilians he knew from other worlds, other Freedom Fighter groups, and villains associated with Eggman. And of course, Eggman himself. And they were all separated into groups.

Amy, looking nervous, came up to Sonic. "Um... Please tell me you have several different sets of memories too..." she said.

Sonic nodded. "Yeah," he said. "This is messed up..."

Amy hugged him in relief. "Oh thank god..." she said. "I was worried I was going insane..."

"If you are, we all are," Sally Acorn said, coming up to him. "We've been comparing notes, what we know of each timeline we were in..."

"You're probably wondering what's going on," said a voice, startling everyone. They looked up, and saw a giant, cobalt-blue cobra looming above them. "If you'll all be silent for a moment, I'll explain."

Eggman fired a missile at him. It exploded harmlessly against the cobra's thick, fat coils.

"Feel better?" the cobra asked.

"Are you alive?" Eggman asked.

The cobra chuckled, amused. "For a given immortal equivalent of alive, yes."

"Then no, I don't," Eggman said grumpily, his mustache bristling in fury.

The cobra sneered. "It doesn't matter anyway. You all are here at my whim. Each of you who remember multiple lives are an amalgam of each version of that person." A spotlight shined on Sally Acorn. "For example, Princess Sally Acorn here is an amalgam of two different Sally Acorns, from two different realities. She has the memories of both worlds, for she has lived both worlds."

Sally, remembering her experiences as Metal Sally in one timeline, clenched her fists angrily. "Yes. And thank you for reminding me of the horror I was suffering in that one reality..." she said.

The cobra ignored her. "Sonic and Eggman are the biggest amalgams. As they are the 'focal point' characters for you worlds. Yes they're more important than all of you GET OVER IT. If you notice allies or enemies missing, its because I didn't want to bring them over. So there. As for me, I am simply Predator, the embodiment of hunger and desire. I have brought you all here against your will because I want to play a game."

"And if we refuse?" Eggman demanded.

"Then you and everything and everyone you love ceases to exist. Painfully," the cobra said. And for a brief moment, he let everyone feel the pain they would suffer as they were erased. Once they had recovered, they all looked up at the cobra, frightened, furious, but willing to cooperate.

The cobra smirked. "As the embodiment of hunger and desire, I enjoy eating and fucking. I want to see all of you do it because... well, I'm bored, have too much power, and can make you. You will all be sent to a Mobius where NONE of you exist. I order you to seduce and eat as many people as possible. I will give you my ability to swallow and digest anything whole, and be healthy and move at extremes of weight. To make it interesting, I'll make it a competition. Each member of the winning team shall be granted a wish, including each VERSION of a teammate. Everyone else will simply be sent home."

"You want us to EAT PEOPLE!?" someone cried out.

"Yes," the cobra said. "And I'd really suggest doing so. You don't want the villains getting a wish, do you?"

Everyone suddenly glanced over at Eggman's faction and the other villain faction, who were all looking contemplative. Reluctantly, the more heroic among them realized that they'd have to become predators to earn that wish.

The cobra, sensing everyone's willingness to participate, grinned. "Then go. Feast on the world. A few things to know - You will have the years of each person you devour added to your lifespan while on this world, so you will potentially live forever. No betraying your team. You can eat each other, but you'll respawn and it won't count towards your predation count. Otherwise, eat and fuck to your heart's content. The game ends when I grow bored! And you'll have my attention for ages, I think... I may have to move you to another Mobius. And don't think you can let your teammates do the eating for you. I can force you to become a bestial predator, a werebeast similar to what Sonic turned into that one time." The cobra grinned. "The Predalympics begin!"

Everyone vanished, reappearing in a base with their team name on it. And reluctantly, they began to spread out and plan.

As for the robots who didn't have bodies like Nicole and Phage, they appeared elsewhere, not sure what was going on, but deciding to go help their friends.

============

The Teams:

1312.content:
=============================
Titan's Tower...
Raven's Room...
Enter at your own peril...
=============================

The half-demon heroine sighed. It had been almost a year since the defeat of the Brain's Brotherhood of Evil. Supervillains were scarce now, usually only going after Superman, Wonder Woman, Batman, or someone else of that level, and stopping regular crimes just didn't have as much pizzazz.

She had matured a lot since then, especially physically. She had gotten taller, and had expanded in the chest and rump areas (although as buxom as she was now, Starfire had blossomed even further). She sometimes flaunted her appearance, using the new 'bounce' in her step to distract Beast Boy from making a tasteless joke. It was undignified, and it caused him to flirt with her more, but it saved her from making more of an effort than needed to stop his gross jokes. Besides, she was starting to like Beast Boy's lavacious remarks about her looks. She had also let her hair grow out a little longer, and went without her hood more often. This got her a bit more attention, but still, it was just frivolous on her part. Normally it would be out of character for her, but she was happy now, and getting tired of being a standoffish goth. She wanted to do more with her life.

But she couldn't tonight. Beast Boy was out at the arcade, breaking in (or just plain breaking) the new games that had come in, Cyborg was wrapped up in his work, and Robin and Starfire were out on a date.

She snickered softly, and wondered if they would be caught making out in midair on the news again.

She sighed, and flipped through some of her spellbooks. Maybe there was something interesting in there to cast. Nothing involving summoning, of course.

Then she paused, noticing a small spellbook she hadn't seen before.

"What the..."

She levitated it over to her hands and opened it. Hastily scribbled notes were inside its pages, written in an ancient language, one she didn't recognize. She frowned, and was about to put it aside, when the text flashed.

All of a sudden, Raven was fascinated with the text. She had to try out at least one of the spells. She quickly scanned the text, spotting text she did recognize, instructions on how to set up the ritual and what words to say.

It took just a few moments of telekinetic levitation of various items, but a pentagram protective circle was quickly drawn on the floor, artifacts representing earth, wind, fire, and water set at the appropriate four points and candles surrounding the circle and lit. She sat cross-legged in the circle and began chanting the words.

Then the book exploded in a cloud of energy.
1312.title: Raven's Boredom

13122.content:
A puff of smoke came out as the spell took it's effect. Raven knew something had changed but did not know what. She checked around that she had all of her limbs, and she tried to do new things, but she was still the same Raven. However, unlike how Raven instructed multiple times, Beast Boy got off his arcade games and peeked into Raven's room.

"Raveeennnn? Whatcha eating?" he asked looking around and smelling something delicious. Raven gave Beast Boy a bad stare as she decided not to reply. She merely just closed the door. She had no clue what Beast Boy was talking about so she would ignore it for the moment. Beast Boy, however, could never ignore his instincts to fetch good food! He morphed into a fly and went into Raven's room. He changed back to a human, out of Raven's sight, and smelt the room looking around quietly. He then smirked. He knew what the smell was now! Beast Boy approached Raven who was practicing spells. She became easily frightened and angry. "Give me one good reason I shouldn't shoot you out of the tower right now!" she shouted. Beast Boy smiled. "You shouldn't" he stated, "because you smell like delicious pizza."

He then suddenly changed his form into a lion pouncing on Raven. "And pizza is good for everyone!" he said as he started to lick Raven. She was powerless to him for some reason. It seemed a side effect of the already awful spell. Beast Boy continued on licking the tasty Raven before starting to gulp her up into his belly. She erked as she didn't enjoy this at all and shouted in retaliation loudly. When he was done eating, Beast Boy went back to his human form with a huge stomach. He patted it as Raven had finally quieted down. "Dunno if I should leave you in there or let you out! Can't say you tasted bad though!" he said with a large burp before going back to his video games.

132.content:
=======================
Turtle Games Store...
Yugi's Room...
=======================

In his neverending quest to prove that he's a better duelist than Yugi Mutou, Seto Kaiba decided to visit Yugi at his house while all his friends were visiting. He was coy about it, building up to the challenge, and amazingly enough finding himself having fun and getting along with Yugi and his friends, Anzu, Otogi, Shizuka, Jonouchi, and Honda.

Then came the challenge.

A few turns later, Seto made his last play of the game. "Lemme see, draw and play fusion substitute Vasago - God Of Destruction, Fusion Gate with Blue Eyes Ultimate Dragon to make Master Of Dragon Knight. Activate facedown Harpy's Feather Sweep to wipe out your facedown cards... Heheh. And leaving your attack mode Retrained Elven Swordsman comepletely helpless to defense itself. I attack, and after damage calculation... I win."

Seto grinned smugly as Yugi scowled at his cards.

Jonouchi laughed, he couldn't help it. "I guess it was the other you that was the good Duelist."

Yugi grumbled, picking up his cards and putting them back into his deck. "Well, he was the one with all the nerve at least."

Seto chuckled, kissing his Blue Eyes White Dragons and shuffling them back into his deck. "Most satisfying. Thank you Yugi."

Yugi grinned. "Hey, I'll get better. And then I'll beat you just as much as the other me did."

Otogi smirked from where he lay on Yugi's bed, sifting through his own deck. "You really think so? After all, Kaiba's had ample time to strategize against every monster you have ever played. Especially since you've decided not to add any new monsters."

Jonouchi threw a pillow at him. "Who's side are you on?!" he snapped, although he grinned as he said it.

The two girls giggled, trading jokes about the boys in whispers. Kaiba was close enough to listen in, and grinned as he heard Anzu tell a doozy about Jonouchi that made Shizuka blush.

"Careful, Jonouchi. Stay neutral or I'll tell you what Anzu just said about you," Seto said, causing Anzu to blush in embarassment now. Shizuka and Yugi giggled as Otogi looked interested.

"Now I'm interested," he said. Jonouchi threw the other pillow that was on the loveseat in Yugi's room at him and glared at Anzu.

"What did you tell her, Anzu?" he demanded. Anzu just smiled innocently and shrugged.

Honda, who was staying out of the line of fire, watched from near a window as Jonouchi tried to get Anzu to tell what she said about him. Failing that, he turned to Seto to try him.

Seto just glared at him for a few moments and he gave up without asking anything. Everyone other than Jonouchi, Seto included, cracked up with laughter.

Honda, recovering himself, looked out the window again... and sweatdropped.

"Um... Yugi?"

"Yeah Honda?"

"We defeated all the Doma guys, right?"

Yugi nodded. "Yeah. Remember, we faced Rafael, Varon, and Amelda at that last tournament Pegasus held?"

Honda nodded. "Dartz and his magic was completely destroyed, right?"

Everyone traded worried looks. "Yeah..." Yugi said.

"Okay... Kaiba, is your hologram tech malfunctioning?"

"Of course not!" Seto snapped, "I'd have been informed immediately if it was!"

Honda nodded slowly. Everyone was VERY nervous now. "I think we're in trouble, then," he said.

"Why's that?" Jonouchi asked hesitantly.

Honda turned back to them, grinning weakly. "There's a Duel Monster outside the window."

1332.title: Better Test Subjects?

134.content:
Gene chuckled to himself as he waddled into Starwind/Hawking's latest headquarters, back in Heifong. His gut, bloating out through his shirt, hung down over his belt, gurgling and churning heavily to digest his meal.

-There is such a thing as karmic justice in this universe,- Gene said, licking his lips and patting his stomach, which contained two women he had eaten earlier this evening.

He glanced up at the glowing clock and saw that it was 10:00 PM. No one else was up at this hour, so he decided he would grab a drink and sleep on the couch, so as not to disturb anyone else.

However, when he came into the business' main lobby, he found that someone WAS up.

Melfina, sporting a large, but not as large as Gene's, belly, sat contentedly on the couch, rubbing her stomach and watching television. This didn't surprise Gene, because as a Bio-Android, one powered by the infinite magic of the Galactic Leyline, she had complete control over her body and needed little sleep. In addition, she could also control her stomach's functions, giving her the option of NOT digesting her prey if she wished, for future disgorging. And if she did digest her prey, she could restore him or her if she so chose with the Leyline's magic. (A fact which he could attest to, having gone through the process himself early on. He wondered briefly whom she had eaten.

Eventually, after a moment, he decided to ask her outright. He caalled out a greeting.

"Hello, Mel."

Melfina looked up and smiled. "Oh, hi Gene. I didn't hear you come in."

Gene shrugged. "I didn't want to wake anyone up. Who's in your belly?" he asked, pointing.

"Jim," Melfina said, chuckling, "he and Aisha got into a fight, he got her mad enough for her to turn into that cat/wolf/whatever it is form of hers, and quite literally jumped into my mouth to avoid getting munched."

"Wimp," Gene teased, tapping Jim through Melfina's belly, causing the young boy to snarl angrily. "Where's Aisha now?" he asked Melfina.

Melfina giggled. "Probably on a rampage or arrested. She'll be back by tomorrow," she said. After a moment a thought came to her. "Hey Gene?"

"Yeah Mel?"

"Would you like to join Jim inside me? I know you like it in there."

Gene looked thoughtful for a moment, considering.

((Edited 1/7/2005 by FFtheSnake))
134.title: Starwind/Hawking Enterprises

choices: "Let's find Aisha and feed ourselves to her."
1342.content:
"Nah, not this time."

Melfina nodded, and said, "Okay Gene. How would you like to just cuddle, then?"

Gene nodded, grinning widely. She snuggled up to him, her Jim-filled belly pressing up against his own. She smiled, and began to caress Gene's tremendous belly.

"So who have you eaten this time?"

Gene smirked. "Remember that voodoo priestess from 1st Earth that cursed me, Jim, Suzuka, and Aisha a while back, made us all hungry and stretchy enough to eat people?"

Melfina blinked, then grinned widely. "You got her?"

Gene grinned, and burped. "And one of her servants, too. Irony's fun, don't you think?"

Melfina nodded. "Especially when it isn't directed against us."

Gene nodded. "Any calls while we were out?"

"Just from the McDougals. Harry was checking up on me, that's all. He's got a new, fully robotic body, synthetic flesh and everything."

Gene frowned. "Oh really?"

Melfina smirked. "I prefer the real thing. Aside from that, he was a little turned off after I told him about what happened to us, and what I did to join you all."

Gene laughed. Melfina grinned even wider. "I offered him to join Jim in my belly, and assured him that I still retain my Leyline powers and could ressurect him after he's digested. (Or if I were digested, if he wanted to go that way.) But he still said no."

Gene shook his head. "Mel, babe, you're something else."

Melfina smirked. "I know," she said, full of the confidence she had gained after the mess with Hazanko had been put to rest forever.

"So what would you like to do now?" she asked.
1342.title: Just Relaxing

13422.content:
Melfina frowned slightly.

"I have no idea where Suzuka is. She left thirty minutes after you did and didn't say where she was going" said Melfina.

"Probably doing an assassination" said Gene.

As soon as he spoke, there was a knock at the door.

"It's unlocked!" yelled Gene, who didn't want to move from the couch. For one thing, he enjoyed Melfina caressing his belly. For another thing, he was just tired. It had been a long day. Tracking down that priestess wasn't an easy job. Gene had gone to Fred Luo for help and Fred had pointed Gene in the right direction. The priestess was at a bar, supposely waiting for someone named Jim O'Haver. Gene had tricked the priestess (and her assistant) into the alley beside the bar. That's when he ate them both. Gene had eaten the priestess first. He licked his lips as he remembered eating her not an hour ago. The priestess had made an excellent meal and the assistant made an even better dessert. Gene burped as the door slowly opened.

It was Suzuka, which sported a huge belly, and had a kid in tow. The kid was probably no older than Jim Hawking was, but he was probably taller than Jim by a good foot. The boy had blond hair and a small tattoo on his left arm. The tattoo was a red rose, probaly not 12 inches long. Suzuka brought the kid over to the couch in front of Gene.

"Bringing home strays?" asked Gene as he looked at the kid. The kid said nothing, but looked wide-eyed at Gene's belly.

"Not exactly" said Suzuka. "I saw him snooping around outside"

"Let me go!" said the kid. "Rose won't be happy with you now that you have me"

"Who's Rose?" asked Melfina.

"My employer you might say" said the kid dryly. Melfina's belly shifted slightly, making the kid jump.

"What were you doing here?" asked Gene.

The kid said nothing.

"Tell us kid, or we'll feed you to our kitty" said Gene, meaning Aisha of course.

"I was sent to check you guys out" said the kid. "Rose may need some help"

"What kind of help?" asked Gene. "and for how much money?"

"Name your price" said the kid. "Rose has heard all about you guys and so have I"

"Has she?" asked Gene, patting his belly.

"Yes" said the kid. "she needs some people to...disappear"

"When?" asked Gene.

"Tomorrow if possible" said the kid.

"Where do we meet this Rose?" asked Suzuka.

"I'll take you guys to her" said the kid. "what do you say? Will you help?"
13422.title: Suzuka's home and not alone

choices: Kevin wakes them up super early
134221.content:
"Alright, kid" said Gene. "I accept"

"Gene!" came Jim's voice from Melfina's belly. "you really think we can trust this girl?"

"I'm a guy!" said the kid loudly to Melfina's belly, making Melfina chuckle.

"Sorry...I can't hear well in here" said Jim.

"Relax, Jim" said Gene. "I think we can trust this kid. What's your name by the way?"

"Kevin" said the kid.

"Well, Kevin, we'll see you tomorrow" said Gene. "don't come to early...I like to sleep in"

"Since when?" asked Jim dryly.

"Hey, shouldn't you be digesting?!" asked Gene sounding angry.

"Takes a few hours for me to digest anybody" said Melfina. "you of all people should remember that, Gene"

Gene did remember. Like any food, people tended to take hours to digest. He remembered the first time that Melfina had eaten him. It took her almost 6 hours to be digested. Melfina restored him in no time at all.

"So, what should we do with Kevin?" asked Suzuka.

"Let him go" said Gene. "he'll be back in the morning"

"Unless..." said Melfina.

"Unless what?" asked Gene.

"Unless Kevin wants to spend the night here" said Melfina.

Kevin's eyes lit up. "I would like that very much"

"Don't you have a home to go to?" asked Gene.

Kevin didn't answer.

"Whatever" said Gene. "alright, you can stay"

Kevin's sleeping arangements were harder to solve. Starwind and Hawking Enterprises only had room for six people and it had six rooms. There seemed to be no room for Kevin.

"I can sleep anywhere" said Kevin. "I've been doing that alot since I met Rose"

"You can sleep in my room" said Melfina. "I hardly ever sleep. I don't need much sleep, being a bio-android"

Kevin went to Melfina's room and fell asleep almost at once.

"I think that Kevin is homeless" said Melfina.

"What was your first clue?" asked Gene. Suzuka went to her room as well, leaving Gene and Melfina alone on the couch. Aisha was clearly in her room, no doubt sleeping off a meal she had earlier.

"Goodnight" said Gene, slowly drifting asleep.

"Goodnight, Gene" said Melfina, still caressing Gene's belly. Gene was using Melfina's belly as a pillow.

135.content:
====================
The Bebop
Meeting Room/Lounge
====================

"Dinner is served," Jet Black said, setting down a plate of fried mushrooms in front of his associates, the lanky, laid back warrior, Spike Spiegel, bouncy, energetic genius, Ed, the canine Ein, and the busty, beautiful, and currently at this moment pissed beyond measure Faye Valentine.

"This is IT?! I thought the bounty heads Spike and I brought in were supposed to bring in over a BILLION wulong apeice!!!"

Jet glared at Spike. "They were. If they were alive," he muttered. Faye shot a look that would have shattered titanium.

"WHAT. HAPPENED."

Ed giggled. "Spike-Spike's in trouble."

Spike glared right back at Faye. "One of them slipped out of their cuffs and freed the other. They attacked, I had to fight back. We barely got enough to survive to the next port."

Faye scowled, and started to say something scathing, but her stomach grumbled in irritation. She sighed.

Ed, Ein, and Jet were all eating their mushrooms, and Spike was sniffing his disdainfully. Faye shook her head and grumbled, starting in on her meager meal.

========
Later...
========

Faye muttered angrily, pacing through the hold of the Bebop and clutching her stomach. She was still incredibly hungry. Before the bounty, it had been a while since her last good meal. And this meager fare tonight didn't help. She was INCREDIBLY hungry and getting hungrier by the minute.

And Ein standing nearby looking forlornly at his empty bowl wasn't helping any.

But as she stared at the chubby dog, a crazy idea began to come to her hunger-addled mind...
135.title: Cowboy Bebop At Dinnertime

choices: Faye swallows Ein all the way down
1351.content:
Faye places her hand on her chin and closes her eyes to think more clearly. Sure, it was theoretically wrong to eat the ships favorite pet and it would probably get her major complaints from Ed, but it would definitely be worth it. Jet and Spike would reprimand her for eating Ein, although they would probably just do it because they did not think of getting to the last piece of meat on board. The easiest to sate was going to be Ed, after they, land she could pick up some piece of shiny scrap for the eccentric genius and that would keep Ed out of her hair for about a few months. Of coarse she could just claim that the dog accidentally got sucked out of the ship by way of the garbage disposal.

With a plan and a contingency plotted out, Faye looked towards Ein with a big friendly smile and slowly crept to the morsel of food. The dog turned to her, Faye freezed up in mid step and continued to hold onto her warm smile.

“Here Ein, come here boy,” She said sweetly. Maybe it was because Ein was a data dog and had a vastly more advanced brain then a normal dog, or maybe it was the fact that Saliva was dripping from Faye’s big smile. Whatever the reason Ein took one look at Faye and hastily ran the other way.

“Son of a bitch,” Faye gripes as she hurries to catch up to her meal. Ein scurries across the cold metal floor looking to and for an escape from his pursuer. He runs under a pile of discarded boxes that had once contained spare parts for the Bebops engine. =================
NYC...
Rooftops...
=================

The russet-skinned gargoyle sighed wearily as he glided over the city.

It had been weeks since Demona's scheme to unleash a genocidal plague on the world had been defeated, the canister quintuple locked away in a sealed room deep underground in a Xanatos facility in Antarctica. Human-gargoyle relations were at an all time low since their revelation, but Xanatos, making good on his promise to repay the gargoyles for saving his son and then some, was doing a lot of spin control. Brooklyn even got a thank you from someone he saved from a mugger.

That still didn't stop problems from arising.

Demona was still around, her insanity even worse since she had accidentally alienated her own daughter, Brooklyn's clanmate, Angela, from her.

A new group of bigots, the vicious Quarrymen, had arisen. They were led by Jon Castaway, formerly John Canmore, who was ironically the more gentle of the three Canmore siblings before losing his mind after a series of accidents and misunderstandings.

There were sightings of Goliath's evil clone, the megalomaniacal Thailog, creating the possibility that he may be alive.

The mutate Wolf, along with the cyborgs Hyena and Jackal, the last still-evil members of Pack, had been sighted in the city recently.

On top of that, it was getting harder and harder for Brooklyn not to be hungry.

He didn't know why his appetite had become so intense. Hudson told him is was a common thing among beaked gargoyles to get a bigger appetite than most as they got older, giving some vague religious reason involving a connection to the gargoyle's supreme deity, known simply as the Dragon.

Brooklyn scowled, and wondered if the Dragon had an appetite like his.

He had been eating more and more lately, eating so much at meals that BROADWAY of all people was suggesting he cut back.

He would love to. He was starting to get a visible pot belly in his once slender frame from all his eating. But no matter how much he ate, it was never enough. He never felt satisfied. He wish he could figure out what it was he needed to eat...

Then the concussion grenade hit him.

Brooklyn let out a surprised cry of pain, falling from the sky like a rock and landing in an alley, mercifully falling into a dumpster full enough to cushion his fall.

He groaned, slowly pulling himself out of the dumpster, which thankfully was filled with papers and not food stuffs. After quickly checking to see if his wings were badly damaged, he looked up to see who had fired the grenade at him.

He scowled. "Oh great. Not you."

Two young lovers were enjoying a night off, sharing in each other's bodies and simply savoring the night. This wouldn't be unusual, but these two were not your usual couple. For you see, they were both gargoyles. Noble creatures, vaguely demonic in appearance, that turned to stone during the day, emerging each night to protect their home from criminals. This urge to protect was a part of their very souls, making them the greatest protectors of this city.

Granted, aside from a few exceptions, humanity was scared to death of them, but that is a story for another day.

One of the two young lovers was named Angela. Her skin was a light, greyish blue and forehead sported two small horns with curved slightly to the side. Her ears were elfish and her breasts were melon-sized and very soft and perky. The other was a greenish male with a prominent lower jaw, wide ears, and a bald-head sporting a trio of small horns in a vertical line up his head. He was very fat, and his vast, round gut hung down over his waist.

The two of them couldn't have been happier together.

They had been courting for a while, Broadway struck by both her beauty and the fact that she had her father's nobility and her mother's strong, firey spirit. (Fortunetly for everyone, that was ALL Angela had got of her mother's personality, since her mother was a human-hating genocidal rogue gargoyle named Demona.) Angela had fallen for Broadway's sensitivity and charming, innocent nature.

And just a couple weeks ago, they had consumated their relationship physically.

They now took every chance they had to enjoy each other's body, both lovers finding ways to get each other incredibly aroused, making sex incredibly satisfying each time. Finally, after night after night of sneaking off during patrol runs, Angela's father, the massive mountain of a gargoyle known as Goliath, had given them an official night off to do whatever they wanted.

The two loved each other deeply, savoring each other's bodies. Sometimes, they even combined each other's fantasies, Angela pretending that Broadway was eating her alive as he licked her over and over, or that she was feeding him to prevent him from gobbling her up.

Although more and more, the two young gargoyles started to harbor the fantasy that they could actually go through with it, both of them having the fantasy of Broadway scarfing Angela up and digesting her into bellyfat. So intense was this sexual fantasy that it would turn them on even more.

They chatted throughout the night, discussing the future, planning the possibility of having children, setting up a rookery for their eggs. The mating season was coming up, the time when gargoyles across the world would be at their most fertile. They talked with amusement about Goliath possibly siring an egg on Elisa, his human companion whom he'd become very close to in passing weeks.

Eventually, the sun started to come up. They gathered up their clothes, not bothering to get dressed again, and leaped off of the building, spreading their wings and catching an air current which carried them back to the castle that was their home. They greeted their clanmates as they returned, teasing Brooklyn lightly by flirting with each other, getting an annoyed grunt from the beaked, maroon-skinned gargoyle. He had gotten over losing Angela to his best friend, but he was still annoyed when they got on his case, the annoyance compounded by the fact that they came back nude. Goliath gave Angela a moderately scolding look, but said nothing more. Judging by his scent, he and Elisa had been sharing a similar evening together.

The sun rose, and each gargoyle took a frightening position as the sun washed over them, turning them to stone for the day.

The next night, the gargoyles broke free from their stone shells, roaring, their eyes glowing.

Goliath greeted the others, leaping down from his high perch to talk with the others.

"Broadway, you're staying here tonight. Angela, get dressed."

"Awww..." they both said, although they knew that there would be no arguing with Goliath.

"You have plenty of time to make out. Tonight is Broadway's turn to guard the castle," Goliath said, staring sternly at Angela.

Angela put her talons on her hips and snorted. "This coming from someone who visits his girlfriend every night after giving a lecture on responsibility."

Broadway sighed, watching his lover as she left. He started to look for Bronx, the wingless gargoyle beast always good for some fun, when he realized that Hudson had taken Bronx with him.

"Phooey," Broadway said, "Well... I could go play with Alex, but the Xanatoses are taking him out to a show. And I always raid the kitchen.... Maybe I could check out Lexington's lab." He continued to mutter to himself as he went inside, trying to figure out what to do all evening. "Yeah... That sounds good, he's been working on some of Sevarius's stuff. Or maybe I could go to the library... Catch up on my reading... Hmmm..."

===================
Someplace hidden...

It was a dark room in a dark place, with very dark intentions indeed for one of its two inhabitants.

"Subject 0004, codename Talon, real name Derek Maza," said a voice with a slight British accent to it, "Captured 9/17/2002 by hired mercenaries Hyena and Jackal." The voice paused for a moment, then continued, "Note to self: See the person who gave them their cybernetic upgrades about possibly getting some myself. If I am to continue working with my creations, most of whom want to turn my intestines into decorative bunting, I will need some protection."

The only illumination in this room was a spotlight coming from the ceiling. It focused on a muscular figure wearing chains that bound it around the wrists and nothing else, laying conconsious on a raised metal platform. The figure was vaguely humanoid in appearance, albiet possessing massive batwings, black fur all over his body, and a head like a black panther.

His name was Talon, a mutate created by a mad scientist named Doctor Anton Sevarius. He used to be a human, a police pilot named Derek Maza. He and his fellow mutates, including his mate, a lioness named Maggie, are allies to the clan of gargoyles protecting Manhattan, his sister the mate of the clan leader. He and his mutates protected the underground, the homeless. He and the other mutates have given up wanting a cure, growing to like their powerful mutate bodies (even Maggie, who was near suicidal the first few weeks of her change), wanting nothing more than revenge on Sevarius for changing them against their will.

But to Talon's horror, he would soon find that he was in the clutches of Sevarius yet again...

Talon groaned weakly, slowly coming awake. He looked around him, hearing only a soft voice in the distance.

"Where... Where am I?" he asked in a gruff voice, "Who's out there?"

"Ah, you're awake. Excellent," said the voice, a familiar red-haired figure coming into the beam of light.

A familiar anger suffused Talon. He roared, baring his razor-sharp fangs, and tried to lunge forward, summoning electricity to fire at the mad scientist. But something in the clamps around his wrists kicked in and turned his electricity inward. Talon screamed in agony, his body briefly crackling with his own electrical ability turned against him, and collapsed on the platform, barely able to move.

Sevarius chuckled and went over to pat Talon on the head like a pet cat, ignoring the angry growls of the helpless mutate. "There's a good lad. You behave now. We have much to do. Yes indeed..."

14121.content:
=================
Demona's Home...
=================

((Author's Note: Takes place immediately after the episode the cloned clan is introduced))

Demona sighed wearily, limping into her study from the rooftop stairs.

Her body was a mess, her mystical healing factor still repairing the severe burns and gaping wounds that she had encurred when a flaming roller-coaster had collapsed on her.

Her wings were shredded, so badly that she had to use a teleportational spell to get to her hideaway in central Manhattan. Blood from her open wounds dripped onto the expensive carpet as she staggered over to her favorite chair and sat down, her wounds slowly healing.

She just didn't care. She didn't care about anything anymore.

She was a ronin, a rogue gargoyle.

Thailog had betrayed her, her daughter had rejected her, any attempt she made to have a clan of her own had backfired.

Alone.

She was alone. The worst thing that can happen to a gargoyle.

And for the first time, she was starting to realize that her loneliness, her banishment, was all of her own doing. Tears streamed down her face as she thought back on everything that had happened in her life, starting from the time she had accepted the Archmage's offer to make her his apprentice...

It was over. She just didn't give a damn anymore.

If MacBeth showed up to finalize their curse and kill her, she'd welcome it...

============
NYC...
Midnight...
============

A tawny furred form moved amongst the shadows of the high-rises of the city, carefully staying out of sight. Her golden, catlike eyes scan the immediate area before she nods, spreading her huge, batlike wings and gliding over to the roof a nearby grocery store.

The elegant creature landed roughly, skidding slightly and chiding herself on her landing. She looked up, hearing a rustling of wings, and smiled, seeing a red-skinned gargoyle flying over her head.

She grinned and waved to him. The red-skinned, beaked creature waved back to her and blew her a kiss before gliding on, causing the catlike woman to blush.

Her name was Maggie Reed, although now she went by Maggie the Cat. She was a human woman who had come to New York a few years ago, only to fall on very hard times and become homeless. She had let herself be tricked by a man named Anton Sevarius into coming to his lab, being mutated into a massive, gargoyle-like humanoid with a lioness's head, bat wings, catlike feet, tawny-yellow fur covering her whole body, and the ability to generate tremendous amounts of electricity. It had taken a while, but with the help of her lover, who had also been victimized by Sevarius and become a panther mutate, and the mysterious gargoyles, including Brooklyn, whom had just flown over her, and who had never really gotten over his crush on her, she had managed to accept her lot in life and use her newfound strength and powers to help others.

She, her lover (now called Talon) and a tiger mutate named Claw had set up shop in an abandoned underground facility, using it to give a warm place to stay for the homeless of the city. She was now going on a run to acquire some food for the people there. After some early problems, Talon had made arrangements with several sympathetic store owners, and gained a full working system that provided for the people they took care of. They maintained a steady friendship with the gargoyles and sometimes worked together.

Now she had other concerns on her mind, such as the garnering of food for the homeless in the city this evening. But her plans would not come into fruition tonight...
