=========================
Temple of the Hokage...
=========================

In the hidden village of Konoha, their lived a great and powerful ruler, the Hokage. He was one of the greatest warriors of the village, his skill surpassed only by his general, who lacked the ambition to try and overthrow his longtime friend.

His name was Chouji Akimachi, and he was a ninja.

But not just any ninja. The Akimachi clan had special abilities, the ability to become giants if they so chose, or even simply expand part of their body to use as a weapon.

It was this that Chouji made frequent use of. For he used this ability to enlarge his jaws and throat, devouring all of his enemies.

Chouji loved to eat, and devouring an enemy of Konoha gave him tremendous satisfaction. Because of his gluttony in this, he had become tremendously fat, almost 700 pounds. But still he was able to move with speed and grace despite his size, making him nearly invincible.

But honestly, he didn't like fighting. He didn't like the fact that Konoha had enemies. (Tasty though they were.) He preferred to let his people live in peace, and live the good life in between meetings.

Just he and his harem of beauties.

Chouji, musing over Konoha's history and how peaceful things had become since he had started consuming the foes of Konoha, waddled down the hall to the room where his harem was.

He through open the silk-lined doors and smiled, his arms outstretched in an inviting gesture. "Ladies! Hokage Chouji is here!"

His harem, Sakura, Ino, Tenten, Hinata, Kurenai, Temari, Tsunade, Shizune, Anko, and Kin, all lay snuggled together on silken pillows. Each one was clad in nothing more than a transparent silk top and silk loincloth, jeweled adorning their wrists and ankles, each one sporting a massively pregnant belly.

Sakura was the first to notice him. "MASTER!" she cried, getting up and running over to him, the other girls following and nuzzling his bulk.

"Hey now, don't crowd! There's more than enough Chouji to go around!" he said, laughing heartily as his harem swarmed him, hugging him and kissing him.

"Have you come to make love to us again, master?" shy, quiet Hinata said, blushing despite herself.

"Sure thing, lovey. I always want my girls to be happy," Chouji said.

The girls all tittered happily. But before anything else could happen, the door slammed open.

It was Asuma, Chouji's mentor.

"Sorry to interrupt your fun, Chouji," Asuma said, causing the girls to cringe. Chouji didn't mind, however. He had publically given Asuma permission to use his real name, something normally forbidden in Konoha. Asuma smiled, and continued, "But Shikamaru has finally captured Naruto."

Chouji nodded. "Good. Then with his digestion, Konoha will finally be free of the threat of the Nine-tailed Fox."

Ino shuddered. "Master, please stay with us. Naruto is too dangerous."

Anko nodded. "Please, Great Hokage. Let us bring you other kinds of physical delights."

Chouji sighed, and patted Anko on the head. "I know you all desire me. I desire you as well. But Naruto is too great a threat to be ignored," he said, gently seperating himself from the girls and waddling towards the opposite door, following Asuma down to the main hall, where Shikamaru was waiting, his shadow holding the orange-clad ninja in place.

"About time, Hokage Butterball," Shikamaru said, his black armor shimmering as he stared through a skylight at the clouds, "I was getting bored keeping this idiot from accessing his demon chakra."

Chouji, clad in nothing but a robe, just smirked. "Hold a few seconds longer. I just need to get him in."

Naruto, his orange uniform in tatters, his long, blonde hair flairing wildly in every direction, just glared at Chouji, his eyes demonic.

Chouji waddled up to him and smirked, grabbing Naruto's shoulders.

"Your threat to the people of Konoha is over, Naruto. Super-Multi Size no Jutsu: Consumption Readiness."

Chouji's jaws and throat expanded. He smirked, and opened his jaws wide, pulling Naruto's head into them...

And then he woke up.

"DAMMIT!" he swore, "And it was such a nice dream, too..."

He sighed and went back to sleep.

14421.content:
=====================================
An ancient palace in Afghanistan...
=====================================

It was a remote, isolated location. A ruined temple from times long ago, when wicked sultans ruled, fulfilling their hedonistic desires. In this particular palace, a great treasure still lurked.

Shadowy figures stalked through the ruins, moving easily through the rotted structures, each one moving gracefully, despite their gangly appearance. Most were small, barely the size of a child. But one was man-sized, the obvious leader.

Finally, he stepped out into a chamber lit only by the light shining through the holes in the roof. On it, a jade serpent lay wrapped around a large, fist-sized emerald. The shadowy man grinned, and stepped out into the light, revealing his dusky skin and black hair and ninja-clothes.

Lord Monty Fiske, better known as the martial arts supervillain Monkey Fist, famous for his monkey-themed crimes, the fact that he made his hands and feet monkeylike via genetic engineering, and his mastery of Monkey Kung Fu, had come to this place out of desperation, breaking his usual patterns. A psychologist would consider this progress, that Monkey Fist would break his obsession with monkeys to go after a snake-themed object. The rest of the super-villain community would just consider this desperate.

He started to walk towards the artifact, when two figures dropped down from above, landing right in front of him and leaning casually against the pillar the artifact was resting on.

One was an athletic, red-headed young girl in dark green pants and a black shirt that exposed her midriff. The other was a lanky, blonde-haired boy in dark khaki and a black t-shirt. Both wore black, form-fitting gloves, and Monkey Fist knew them both VERY well.

And hated them.

"KIM POSSIBLE! And you, Ron Stoppable, my most hated nemesis!! How did you get here?!"

Ron grinned impishly. He never got tired of Monkey Fist treating him like a nemesis. But business before pleasure.

"We called in a favor from the US army," Kim said, shrugging, "We would have been here sooner, but on the way they spotted someone they had been looking for and wanted to catch him."

"But we're here now, ready to whoop freaky monkey-man butt!!" Ron said, both he and Kim taking a fighting stance. Ron HATED monkeys, but he knew he had to put aside his fear. He and Monkey Fist shared a link due to the magical energies that both had been infused with, enhancing their strength, speed, and martial arts ability. Ron's power only worked part-time, however.

Monkey Fist laughed. "Do you really intend to fight me, Stoppable? Or perhaps Kim's courage is finally rubbing off on you. I've heard that you two are officially a couple now."

Ron blushed, but didn't stop smiling. Kim just grinned. "That's right, we are. And more than that, Monkey Fist. He WILL be the one fighting you. He specifically asked to fight you this time."

Monkey Fist laughed. "What can that coward do to me? What makes you think he can even access the blessing of the powers that were never meant to be his and use them well?"

Kim traded grins with Ron and said, "I've been training him."

Before Monkey Fist could react, Ron flipped forward, striking him with a blitz of five kicks to the face. Monkey Fist fell back, stunned. He stared at Ron and Kim for a long moment, then smiled.

"Well. Perhaps this will be interesting after all. MONKEY NINJAS ATTACK!"

A dozen monkeys, all clad in ninja garb, lunged forward, chittering. Kim leaped forward and sent half of them flying with a roundhouse kick, dueling with the monkeys as Ron fought their leader.

Monkey Fist snarled, leaping up to an overhanging steel bar. He gripped it with his hands while using his monkey-like feet to duel with Ron, thrusting punches and chops at the younger warrior, who was barely managing to fight back. He had to give the boy credit, he WAS better than the last time he faced him, but still not nearly enough of a match for him.

"So," Ron said, trying to distract Monkey Fist from the intense battle by making idle chatter, maybe hoping he'd make Classic Villain Mistake #30 and blab his plans for prideful reasons. "Why are you after this snake statue anyway? Isn't (yick) monkey-themed stuff more your deal?"

Monkey Fist flipped, striking Ron with a double-palmed blow that sent him flying over the pedastal the snake statue was on and crashing into a wall. "I have made an exception to my usual theme, as this emerald and statue have a very close connection to the power that infuses us both, my rival. And now that I have defeated you, I will collect that power for myself!"

Kim was easily whooping the monkey ninjas, and was idly listening in to Monkey Fist and Ron. _Hmmm..._ Kim thought, _If it's that powerful, better not let him get it._

As the dazed Ron tried to recover and Monkey Fist casually strode towards the statue, Kim whipped out her grappling gun and fired it. The hook shot forward rapidly, striking the statue and knocking it off of the pedastal.

Right into Ron's arms. He blinked, surprised, and grinned, holding it up triumphantly. "BOOYAH! Got the statue before you, monkey man!"

Monkey Fist screamed angrily. "AAAGH!! It's useless to us now! Monkey ninjas retreat!"

Monkey Fist ran off, his ninjas following. Kim and Ron just stared. "Huh..." Ron managed after a moment.

"That was... rather anti-climactic."

Ron frowned at the statue. "What I wanna know is, why it's useless just by me touching it?"

The snake statue wrapped around the emerald turned to Ron and grinned. "You're about to find out, warrior of the mystic power," it said.

Kim and Ron stared at the statue. "Umm... KP... This thing just talked to me..." Ron said.

"Put it down now, Ron, before... RON!!" Kim said. The statue's eyes started glowing and fired twin beams of green light into Ron's own. Ron screamed as he felt a powerful energy forced into him. After what seemed like forever to Kim and Ron, but was really only a few seconds, the beam stopped, and Ron collapsed. Kim immediately whipped out the Kimmunicator.

"WADE! I need a ride now, and a forcefield to contain a mystic artifact that zapped Ron!"

The chubby, hyper-intelligent black young man nodded, quickly contacting one of their past clients and calling in a favor, at the same time reconfiguring the Kimmunicator to generate a forcefield to carry the snake statue. He knew better than to ask when Kim was panicking and just do as she asked, knowing that he'd get answers later...

==================
Later...
Kim Possible's room...
==================

About a day later, Ron groaned, clutching his head as he slowly came awake. He blinked, his eyes adjusting to the light as he looked around, trying to get his bearings. After a moment, he recognized where he was.

"Kim's room? And I'm in KP's bed?" he blushed briefly, naughty fantasies running through his head, but then memories of what happened started to come back. He groaned, sitting up, finding himself in a pair of his pajamas. "Geez, how long was I out?"

"About a day and a half," Kim said, smiling warmly and looking VERY relieved, "After that damn artifact zapped you, I brought you to Mom. She couldn't find anything physically wrong with you, so we just kept you here. I had your Mom send over some of your clothes." She was carrying a bag of Bueno Nacho, looking like she just came in from outside, clad in blue sneakers, loose-fitting jeans, and a green tanktop, and Ron's nose, ever sensitive to the smell of his favorite food, picked up the scent of something delicious.

"Is that Nacos?" he said, grinning.

Kim nodded, tears coming to her eyes. "Yep. Grande-sized. It was gonna be my lunch, but I'd be happy to... to..." she broke down, hugging Ron tightly and crying. Ron blinked, and hugged her back.

"Oh God, Ron, I'm so sorry... I just... When that thing zapped you, I was so worried that I'd lose you..." she said.

Ron chuckled. "Hey, KP, c'mon. Bein' over-emotional is my thing, not yours."

Kim grinned weakly, but still wouldn't let go. "I'm sorry... It's just that, in all our missions, I never thought I actually may...!" she choked, unable to finish the thought.

Ron blinked, and blushed. "Hey, KP, c'mon. I'm fine, see? I wouldn't cut out on you like that. We're buds. Little more than buds, actually," he said, blushing deeply at the implication. Kim blushed as well, and kissed him.

Ron almost melted. He'd been kissed before by Kim, but it never failed to make him feel warm and tingly all over. "Anyway," he said, trying to ease the obvious tension, "Why don't we eat, and you can tell what's been goin' on since I took my nap?"

Kim nodded, more than a little embarassed by her behavior, but not really caring since Ron was all right. She handed two of the Nacos in the bag to Ron, who eagerly began to eat them, feeling strangely hungry. Kim gathered her thoughts and began to speak.

"Well, after Mom had you checked out from some of her doctor friends, we updated your parents on what happened. They weren't happy with it, but they're just glad you're fine. Wade has the statue at his place and is analyzing it, checking records on it, he said he'd be a while. I got a call from the vet. Rufus is fine, he just needs to stay there a couple days more until he gets over his flu. Right now, Mom, Dad, and the Tweebs are out," she said, smirking, "They're at a parent/teacher conference. Apparently, while we were stopping Monkey Fist, they created a portal to another dimension and summoned some kind of demon over."

Ron rolled his eyes. Kim's younger brothers, twins Jim and Tim, were super-geniuses. He also suspected that they had ADHD from the way they acted sometimes. He polished off his Nacos in record time, and was about to look in the bag for more when he felt a sudden wave of nausea.

He groaned, getting Kim's attention. "Ron, what's wrong?"

Ron shook his head. "I dunno KP..."

choices: Tim adds the snake DNA & appetite enhancers...
145.content:
Tim Scam frowned at his two chosen allies for this new anti-WOOHP mission, Dr. Inga Bittersweet and Helga von Guggen. The two older women, like many of the villains Scam's enemies, the spies Sam Simpson, Clover Ewing, and Alex Vazquez, had a rather... 'thematic' modis operandi.

Helga von Guggen was vicious enough to earn Scam's respect. Her first scam involved mutating a cruise ship full of people into what the internet people would call 'furries' and then skin them alive for their coats. Her second scam involved murdering people by making clothes that would constrict them to death, tricking people into wearing them by going under another name.

Inga Bittersweet was... somewhat lower on the villain scale. Scam still had trouble figuring out what she wanted to accomplish. She made a super-addictive and super-FATTENING formula and put it in cookies, selling them and making a fortune while making everyone that ate them, including Clover and the boss of the spies, Jerry, extremely fat. But she was stopped when she became addicted to her own formula, giving WOOHP a chance to make a counter-agent to the fattening formula in the cookies.

Honestly, Scam just wanted Helga so he could kill everyone, Sam, Alex, and Clover included, and call it a day, but she wouldn't come without Inga (whom WOOHP had left fat out of spite), whom she made friends with while in prison. And now, they were combining ideas.

Arrange things so that the Spies and a few of their friends and fellow WOOHP agents would win a prize, a lifetime supply of cookies from a cookie company executive (played by Tim Scam himself, master of disguise and deception). But these cookies would be treated with a special formula, an even more addictive and fattening, and one that would turn them into feline creatures the fatter they got. The logic was that they'd be so humiliated and heavy that they'd be unwilling and unable to do anything to stop Tim Scam from his genocidal plans.

(Of course, he left out any mention of genocide to them.)

Tim Scam checked his watch irritatedly. The two older women, one skinny and anorexic looking, one fat and huge, both dressed in labcoats, had been working at their formula for hours. They said that it could be easily mass-produced once they had perfected the formula. As soon as he did, he yipped, startled, as the two women traded high fives.

"HA! We did it!" Helga cheered.

"It's ready?" Scam asked.

Inga nodded. "Yes. All we have to do is take it to the factory and reproduce it, then put it in the cookies, and then the plan can begin for real."

Scam grinned wickedly. "EXCELLENT."

The three villains all shared a moment of evil laughter. After they stopped, Helga said, "Inga and I were going to go out for a bite to eat. Want to join us?"

Scam shook his head, and said, "No. I have some thinking to do."

The two women nodded and left. Scam sighed, and shook his head, looking over the various chemicals mounted on the wall of the lab, which for some reason was painted black on the walls, floors, and ceiling.

"This is such a stupid plan," he said.

He was about to leave to get some coffee, when his eyes settled on two particular vials.

"Snake DNA and appetite enhancer..." Scam said. He had a brief vision of a snake swallowing a gazelle, and grinned mildly.

"I wonder..."
145.title: Tim Scam's Scam

15.title: List 5

151.content:
==============
Outworld...
Wastelands...
==============

Chaos reigned. All warriors once thought dead are alive once more. Armageddon is approaching, and only the strongest will survive. Kombat rages all around, battles to the death now a common site.

In the outer wastes of the realm, where the sky is a dark, burning purple and ruins are everywhere, two figures are battling near a massive gate and stairway, a catapult with flaming debris nearby. Two figures fight in this arena, one a man with scaly skin and reptillian features, the other a beautiful, buxom woman in a very revealing outfit and a veil that hit the lower half of her face.

The lizardman was called, appropriately enough, Reptile. He was one of the last two survivors of his species, and for the first time was on his own. He was tired of being used by evildoers and was intent on finding his own life.

The woman was Mileena, a partial clone of the princess Kitana. She was Shao Kahn's daughter, and one of his top assassins alongside Reptile, but she now wanted a kingdom of her own. She intended to replace her sister and rule Edenia, conquering all who have harmed her over her centuries of life.

But first, before either fighter could achieve their goal, they had to get past each other.

Reptile snarled, the lizardlike man spitting a globule of acid at the slinky female form attacking him. The beautiful, scantily clad female chuckled softly and vanished into a hole in the ground and appearing above him, her boot's spiked heel dropping into Reptile's face.

The lizard-man snarled, bearing his jaws and his long, sticky tongue.

Mileena laughed, her veil briefly blowing aside in the wind to reveal her one physical flaw, her razor-sharp Tartakan teeth and her wide mouth. She twirled her sais and laughed.

"It's over, lizard!" Mileena laughed, "I've been wanting to kill you for centuries!"

Reptile hissed angrily. "Killing me will be more difficult that you think, you cheap imitation!"

Mileena howled in rage and rushed Reptile. She HATED being called an imitation! Reptile rolled out of the way of her leaping sai thrust and drew his sword.

He was in for a long battle...

==============
Chaosrealm...
==============

A single, solitary figure slunk quietly through the twisting streets and canals of the chaotic realm. Her athletic, but still very feminine form was hidden beneath a cloak, her body clad underneath in a gray ninja leotard with boots and gauntlets. Her skin was green and reptillian, but her face was mostly human in appearance. Long black hair tied in a ponytail hung over her should as she tried to make her way out of the realm.

Her name was Khameleon. She was the last female of her species, the same species as Reptile.

A species, she was now certain, would become extinct.

She had been on the run for several milennia, trying to avoid being killed by assassins sent by Shao Kahn. She wanted nothing more than to unite with Reptile, to free him from Shao Kahn's control and start their species over again. But Shao Kahn, not wanting to lose an assassin as skilled as Reptile, had kept her away from him, constantly hounding her with a powerful assassin cloned from her DNA, which he had acquired when he had Shang Tsung fight her, and Reptile's.

To mock her, Kahn named this assassin Chameleon.

She had been forced to run from Chameleon for years, Chameleon seemingly gaining new powers every time they fought. Khameleon taught herself how to fight back by secretly observing three of Kahn's greatest assassins, Kitana, Mileena, and Jade, and learning their fighting styles, her natural ability to turn invisible hiding her from their sight, her natural stealth keeping the skilled killers from finding her.

Only Chameleon could see through her illusions.

Finally, during Kahn's invasion of Earthrealm, she was able to catch up with Chameleon. Using magic she had stolen from Shang Tsung, she gave Chameleon a will of his own and an urge to prove himself to be stronger than anyone. He quickly abandoned her and began searching out powerful Outworld warriors to test his strength against.

Khameleon caught up with Raiden's forces first, and learned, to her horror, what Reptile had done over the years. All the atrocities, the genocide, that Reptile had happily commited in Shao Kahn's name.

Still, she still felt she could redeem him, a hope suffusing her every action as she aided Raiden's forces in driving back Shao Kahn in her own discreet way. Finally, she cornered Reptile and told him everything, how Shao Kahn had destroyed their people, and made her offer.

Reptile laughed in her face. He refused to believe that Shao Kahn was the exterminator of his people. Worse yet, he refused to believe that she was of Zaterra, a Raptor like he was. He threatened to kill her, and probably would have, if Jade hadn't intervened.

Lost, hopeless, and in despair, she wandered away aimlessly, disappearing from the battlefield. Jade tried to offer her words of comfort before she left, but it did no good. The other warriors, upon hearing what happened to her, were sad, but not particularly surprised.

Khameleon wandered the realms aimlessly for years, doing little more than walking, drinking, eating, and sleeping. Despair was all she had left. She barely noticed the dramatic events unfolding, Shinnok's attempted return, the rise and fall of the Deadly Alliance, all was ignored by her.

Then, when she heard that Reptile had been possessed by the ancient Dragon King, Onaga, who was purported to be the true ruler of Outworld, she began to go insane.

She began to hate.

She began to travel once more, intent on nothing more than destruction. She was now seeking tomes of magic, intent on using them to bring about the death of EVERY species. Every member of every species in every realm... save two.

To her increasingly deranged mind, it was the perfect revenge. Fate had denied her a chance to restore her race. If her people were doomed to extinction, then she believed that every OTHER race should be as well.

As she travelled, she heard stories of Armageddon approaching, that every fighter from the past was coming alive again for one last battle. Reptile had apparently freed himself from Onaga as well, and was looking to start his life anew.

She no longer cared. If the realms were destroyed, then that would be fine. It would save her the trouble. But she refused to take part in the war. When the pillar of flame appeared in the sky, she ignored it. She had work to do, research to find. If, somehow, Armageddon was evaded, she would find a way to cause it herself.

Several people had tried to stop her, some Tarkata and some filthy Oni.

Those that didn't die from having various parts of their bodies eaten by her were killed when she split them in half with her sword.

Heaven help any who tried to stop her. For Khameleon had quite literally gone mad with rage and despair, and would devour anyone who got in her way...

153.content:
The mass of green protoplasmic ooze with its glowing, luminous core sloshed about the underground cavern it had been forced into. It was the Hamidon, and it had a mission.

"EARTH IS IMPURE, INFESTED WITH HUMANS, EVIL LIVING CREATURES THAT DESPOIL ITS LANDS AND WATERS. I MUST TRY AND STOP THEM AT ANY COST," it said in a voice that no human or superhuman could understand.

"MANY TIMES I HAVE TRIED TO LEAD MY CREATIONS IN THE CONQUEST OF PARAGON CITY," it said as it crawled around the dark, stone cavern, it's amoebea-like body absorbing the stone around it to make it smooth, "BUT EACH TIME I HAVE MET WITH DEFEAT, DRIVEN FURTHER INTO THE EARTH BY THE SO-CALLED 'HEROES' THAT DEFEND THE CITY ABOVE. AND MY CREATURES ARE DEFEATED EVERY DAY."

Hamidon slid into the center of the chamber and paused. "I MUST TRY AGAIN, WITH DIFFERENT TACTICS."

It expanded itself, slamming into the ground at the top of the chamber and casting its mutagenic powers into the ground.

Normal animals all around the city, raccoons, cats, dogs, snakes, rats, and zoo animals, began growing in size and strength. Their intelligence grew to human-levels and in some cases beyond. And lastly, he infused them with a tremendous hunger for human flesh, the ability to swallow anything whole, and the ability to digest anything they swallowed.

"GO, MY CHILDREN. GO AND CONSUME THE HEROES THAT INFEST THIS CITY. SEEK OUT THE VILLAINS AS WELL, AND OFFER THEM THE GIFT OF YOUR APPETITE. IF THEY WILL NOT CONVERT, THEN CONSUME THEM. PURGE THIS CITY. SO SPEAKS THE HAMIDON."

====================================
Twenty minutes later...
On every TV in Paragon City...
====================================

"This is a Paragon News Special Report. In the latest in events strange even for this city, all the animals in the city's seven zoos have grown in size and broken out of their cages. Several heroes volunteered to go after them, but none of them have returned. In other news, several dozen disappearances have been reported as well. All heroes in the area are asked to assist police and other authorities in their investigations..."

((Which story will you write about first? Heroes getting eaten or attempted villain recruitment?))

1551.content:
The Killer Instinct tournament.

Held by the Ultratech Corporation, it was there sick way of gathering resources and gaining fame via violent, gory battles with everything from human warriors to aliens to robots to their own monstrous creations. One of their greatest creations was a crossbreed human/reptile named Riptor. A vicious, vile creature that ate several opponents, sometimes swallowing them whole in his ravenous hunger.

Riptor was defeated and killed by the cybernetically enhanced boxer known as TJ Combo.

But unbeknownst to anyone, there was another Riptor, one stronger and more powerful than the first. This one remained in the dungeons of the Ultratech building, kept locked up because he was more intelligent than his predecessor. He could not speak, but he could reason, and understand human language, and even solve simple puzzles.

Ultratech kept him alive because he was a curiosity. They fed him dead fighters as well as other meats, and promised him that once they could arrange it, they would give him a mate, one that would bear children for him.

This was fine with this Riptor, although he was a little jealous of the first one, who got to fight and eat living opponents whole. As he watched his predecessor on the television they provided for him, he wondered what it was like to feel living prey inside his belly.

Then, his predecessor was killed by TJ Combo.

He became concerned then. No one had come yet to feed him today, and he wondered if Ultratech was going back on their word. He decided to wait and see, and continued watching the tournament.

When Orchid defeated and killed the monstrous Eyedol, knocking him into a pit of lava, everything changed. To the surviving Riptor, it felt as if the universe itself shifted, but in reality it was time itself. The Ultratech building was being dragged bodily into the past, along with all the Killer Instinct fighters and Ultratech staff inside of it. The echoing of a powerful demon's laughter thundered through the building as Riptor struggled to stay standing through the violent shaking of the building.

Finally, the building stopped shaking. It was cracked in several places, letting light into Riptor's underground lair. The building walls creaked ominously, and Riptor guessed that the place was on the verge of collapsing. He debated briefly what to do, when something caught his eye.

HIS GATE WAS OPEN.

He quickly ran out just as the roof of his lair collapsed. Not stopping to look back, he quickly made his way out, killing whoever got in his way with blasts of fire and slashes with his tail or claws.

Finally, he found a doorway leading out. The rich scents of plant and animal life in this area reached his nostrils, and he realized that something had happened, since he couldn't smell anything urban save for the building. Unknowingly, he had gone back in time.

But Riptor didn't care. He was free.

Free to hunt for the first time in his life.
1551.title: Another Riptor

choices: You wake up to see an old man with a pretty young nurse standing over you...
You wake up to see a MONSTER staring at you!!
You are alone, but changed... and strangely hungry...
1552.content:
Your name is Arashi. You are a handsome young man who lives in Tokyo and goes to a high school in the Shibuya district. You have blue eyes, an unusual feature, and shoulder-length hair that you've dyed with a white streak. You're smart, and a generally kind person but rebellious, dressing in deliberately torn jean and a black tank top. You love your parents but like annoying them.

Today, you're heading to the Shinjuku Eisei hospital. Your father left something of his there after a checkup yesterday, and in a rare moment of cooperation with your parents, a Shinto priestess and a corporate executive at Cyverse, you agreed to get it. The news was filled with strange reports about a cult and murders connected to it, and had pre-empted all your favorite shows anyway.

You skip downtown, your new white sneakers clopping on the pavement as you listen to music on your new MP3 player, your golden necklace with a picture pendant of your family on it bouncing up and down, the fingerless leather gloves you wear creaking slightly with each dancing movement. You head into the hospital, and become very confused. Very few people seem to be about, just a tiny scattering of nurses. You recognize one of your friends from school, Tachibana Chiaki, and talk with her for a few moments.

Chiaki doesn't know what's going on either.

You sigh, and head on up to the floor your father was on, hoping to find it at the office.

Then, just as you step out of the elevator, the world blew up.
1552.title: The End Of The World

choices: You wander off to the south, finding a group of humanoid figures...
You wander off to the north, encountering a succubus...
15523.content:
You woke up in the city. Or what was left of it. As you come to your senses, you look around you in shock. The world... has changed. The city itself was in ruins, buildings abandoned and falling apart. The hospital you were in was completely destroyed, the elevator you had gotten into blown out into the street. In addition, the world was changed. It seems to loop around on itself, as if the world has inverted. You look up into the sky, seeing cities and forests above you. You stare for a long moment, shocked... before coming to your senses.

"Okay," you said. "You're in a world that's gone literally inside out after... after the apocalypse, apparently." You really hoped that the American evangelists weren't right about the Rapture, because if that's true then you've been left behind... You look down at yourself. You've been stripped of your shirt, but were now taller and more muscular. Your body was now lined with glowing black stripes. You looked at your reflection in some broken glass, and saw that your eyes were now yellow.

"Oh, good, I've been transformed..." you mutter sarcastically. You felt a strange power flowing through you, but you had no desire to explore it right now. You wanted to find someplace safe. You felt like you were in extreme danger out in the open here.

Plus, you needed to find some food. You were freaking hungry.
15523.title: Alone but Hungry...

info.description: This is a sequel to the interactive Vore story, TV Vore, created with permission from Dawnbringer, author of the original. Characters from old and new tv shows chow down on people. Please add on. Nearly anything goes.
